How does a provider repay a debt? family.answer: To get Child Care Subsidy you need to submit a claim. You must be using an approved child care provider. If eligible, we'll pay the subsidy directly to your provider. If eligible, we may be able to backdate your subsidy for up to 28 days.

Do you get money back from child care?.answer: To help families avoid an end of year debt a portion of Child Care Subsidy is also withheld each fortnight. The default withholding amount is 5 per cent. This means that you will pay a little extra to your child care service as part of the fees paid during the year.

How do I claim back child care subsidy?.answer: To get Child Care Subsidy you need to submit a claim. You must be using an approved child care provider. If eligible, we'll pay the subsidy directly to your provider. If eligible, we may be able to backdate your subsidy for up to 28 days.
